description.narrative: Le projet constitue un des 4 sous programmes du Programme de partenariat pour la gestion durable des terres au Burkina Faso (Country Partnership Programme for Sustainable Land Management - CPP/SLM)
first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Objective To establish a coordinated decentralized system of sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management in the CentreWest region

1 Number percentage of relevant SLM interventions that are a planned and b implemented collaboratively among different stakeholder types c and that are deemed relevant and effective by evaluation processes Definitions a refers to identification counting and planning of SLM interventions relevant to the project both on the ground ie at site level and through enabling action relevant here means that interventions that are either i spearheaded ii cosupported or iii influenced by the project b refers to the level of collaboration coordination among stakeholders from implementation c refers to the level of success of SLM interventions implemented visavis the planned ones with focus on relevance and effectiveness Means of Verification through the projectís SLM interventions database planning and periodic reporting documents plus other indirect means that can be assessed by the MTR and TE and NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014 Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes

comment.narrative:
1a Both enabling and sitelevel SLM interventions in the Centre West region are still to be more carefully identified PRODOC provides but generic guidance
1b No partnership or coordination mechanisms for SLM is in place in the region for implementation
1c The CPPCW ie the Country Partnership Programme Burkina Faso CentreWest Region CPPCW Subprogramme in November 2013 and an evaluation schedule was developed
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014 Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes

General target Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75 of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project
1a The project keeps a thorough database of its SLM interventions and can document their planning and implementation the database issues a count for the number and nature of SLM interventions i spearheaded ii cosupported or iii influenced by the project upon which a benchmark percentage can be calculated
1b The Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region is in place and meets regularly with good prospects to continue to do so after project end to propose plan foster and review the implementation of SLM interventions
1c An evaluative analysis of SLM interventions registered in the database establishes that at least 75 of them meet at least one of the criteria for the indicator that they are coordinated jointly planned or collaboratively implemented

Target for indicators 1 is generally on the way to being achieved For sub indicators it is as follows Target achieved for 1a database development target achieved and being consolidated for 1b the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region and this creates the basis for making progress towards the target for 1c evaluative analysis of SLM interventions as a key tool for ensuring that SLM interventions being monitored are coordinated jointly planned or collaboratively implemented
The mechanism the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region is in place Efforts were focused on all measures actions and arrangements required for making more and more effective and sustainable In fact during the consultation process undertaken in the previous review period the CenterWest Regional Partnership Platform for sustainable land management was established bylaw 2014097MATDRCOSGVTKDGSG of 11th September 2014 issued by the regional Authority It is chaired by the Regional Council of CenterWest which is a local government at the scale of the region to which the central Government has recently transferred the competency to manage the regional natural resources The mandate is described in appropriate documents but includes coordination oversight and ME of SLM interventions
It was officially installed in its functions and has held two ordinary sessions during the period under review to validate the findings of studies on i the reference status of certain indicators of the logical framework of the CPP CenterWest SubProgram ii the environmental profile of the CenterWest Region and iii current status of the issues relating to the use and management of micro watersheds It is gradually and actually gaining momentum with the development and validation of its roadmap for year2015 The Monitoring Evaluation system owned by the CenterWest CPP subprogram is being operationalized in the region It is part of the National Environment and Sustainable Development Observatory ONEDD which is a global environmental monitoring instrument in Burkina Faso It was put in place by the Permanent Secretariat of the National Council for Environment and Sustainable Development with the technical and financial support of the CPP National Coordination SubProgram It has a mechanism for collecting and processing available environmental information in the country to enhance the value and disseminate such information in the form of indicators data and metadata Its monitoring evaluation system derived from the PressureStateImpactResponse model includes a specific component dedicated to SLM and named harmonized SLM Monitoring Evaluation system aimed at ensuring Monitoring Evaluation of the activities related to the implementation of the three Rio Conventions on namely the Convention to Combat Desertification and the ones on Climate Change and Biological Diversity The monitoring of SLM performance and outcome indicators The management of a data base and metadata Harmonization of methods standards and reference tools for data collection and processing This mechanism is lead at the regional level by a focal point that provides support to the partners and stakeholders that are through the partnerships agreements and charters that were signed data centers for the various SLM components producing information for their own needs with their core resources and feeding into the observatory in a winwin relationship

General target Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75 of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project
1a The project keeps a thorough database of its SLM interventions and can document their planning and implementation the database issues a count for the number and nature of SLM interventions i spearheaded ii cosupported or iii influenced by the project upon which a benchmark percentage can be calculated
1b The Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region is in place and meets regularly with good prospects to continue to do so after project end to propose plan foster and review the implementation of SLM interventions
1c An evaluative analysis of SLM interventions registered in the database establishes that at least 75 of them meet at least one of the criteria for the indicator that they are coordinated jointly planned or collaboratively implemented

Target for indicators 1 is generally on the way to being achieved For sub indicators it is as follows Target achieved for 1a database development target achieved and being consolidated for 1b the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region and this creates the basis for making progress towards the target for 1c evaluative analysis of SLM interventions as a key tool for ensuring that SLM interventions being monitored are coordinated jointly planned or collaboratively implemented
The mechanism the Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Centre West Region is in place Efforts were focused on all measures actions and arrangements required for making more and more effective and sustainable In fact during the consultation process undertaken in the previous review period the CenterWest Regional Partnership Platform for sustainable land management was established bylaw 2014097MATDRCOSGVTKDGSG of 11th September 2014 issued by the regional Authority It is chaired by the Regional Council of CenterWest which is a local government at the scale of the region to which the central Government has recently transferred the competency to manage the regional natural resources The mandate is described in appropriate documents but includes coordination oversight and ME of SLM interventions
It was officially installed in its functions and has held two ordinary sessions during the period under review to validate the findings of studies on i the reference status of certain indicators of the logical framework of the CPP CenterWest SubProgram ii the environmental profile of the CenterWest Region and iii current status of the issues relating to the use and management of micro watersheds It is gradually and actually gaining momentum with the development and validation of its roadmap for year2015 The Monitoring Evaluation system owned by the CenterWest CPP subprogram is being operationalized in the region It is part of the National Environment and Sustainable Development Observatory ONEDD which is a global environmental monitoring instrument in Burkina Faso It was put in place by the Permanent Secretariat of the National Council for Environment and Sustainable Development with the technical and financial support of the CPP National Coordination SubProgram It has a mechanism for collecting and processing available environmental information in the country to enhance the value and disseminate such information in the form of indicators data and metadata Its monitoring evaluation system derived from the PressureStateImpactResponse model includes a specific component dedicated to SLM and named harmonized SLM Monitoring Evaluation system aimed at ensuring Monitoring Evaluation of the activities related to the implementation of the three Rio Conventions on namely the Convention to Combat Desertification and the ones on Climate Change and Biological Diversity The monitoring of SLM performance and outcome indicators The management of a data base and metadata Harmonization of methods standards and reference tools for data collection and processing This mechanism is lead at the regional level by a focal point that provides support to the partners and stakeholders that are through the partnerships agreements and charters that were signed data centers for the various SLM components producing information for their own needs with their core resources and feeding into the observatory in a winwin relationship

description.narrative: 2 Level of adoption or integration of SLM priorities and principles by key regionallevel institutions policies strategies and planning frameworks

comment.narrative: Relevant regional program frameworks ie regionallevel institutions policies strategies and planning frameworks have not integrated SLM priorities and principles more specifically PRODOC Table 5 establishes what the regional programming frameworks but it is outdated

The relevant regional programmatic frameworks to be targeted by the project have received assistance by the project and include SLM priorities and principles in their new planning cycle the level of adoption integration of SLM priorities and principles will be independently assessed by the MTR and TE

Continued progress towards the target is made through extensive regional consultations and data compilation The main regional framework of relevant programming targeted by this indicator is the Regional Development Plan RDP Central West whose client is the Regional Council The strategy is to provide the region with a SLM action plan incorporating regional principles and priorities for SLM and thus provide the actors of the material to develop a new generation of Central West Regional Development Plan The roadmap of the platform which consists of activities whose conduct is considered a prerequisite to creating the conditions for effective coordination of interventions and initiatives on SLM in the Central West region aims to make contribution all stakeholders and to coordinate their actions to achieve the Partnerships goals in SLM The results of the implementation of the roadmap envisaged by years end will learn about the ability of mobilization and coordination of interventions in support of SLM in the region The analysis and lessons learned from this review will allow the platform to develop a threeyear action plan whose implementation will enable the coordination planning and joint implementation of interventions and initiatives including integrating the priorities and major principles of SLM in the Central West Region We must remember that these principles and priorities have already been integrated into training modules provided to members of the SLM platform in Central West

The relevant regional programmatic frameworks to be targeted by the project have received assistance by the project and include SLM priorities and principles in their new planning cycle the level of adoption integration of SLM priorities and principles will be independently assessed by the MTR and TE

Continued progress towards the target is made through extensive regional consultations and data compilation The main regional framework of relevant programming targeted by this indicator is the Regional Development Plan RDP Central West whose client is the Regional Council The strategy is to provide the region with a SLM action plan incorporating regional principles and priorities for SLM and thus provide the actors of the material to develop a new generation of Central West Regional Development Plan The roadmap of the platform which consists of activities whose conduct is considered a prerequisite to creating the conditions for effective coordination of interventions and initiatives on SLM in the Central West region aims to make contribution all stakeholders and to coordinate their actions to achieve the Partnerships goals in SLM The results of the implementation of the roadmap envisaged by years end will learn about the ability of mobilization and coordination of interventions in support of SLM in the region The analysis and lessons learned from this review will allow the platform to develop a threeyear action plan whose implementation will enable the coordination planning and joint implementation of interventions and initiatives including integrating the priorities and major principles of SLM in the Central West Region We must remember that these principles and priorities have already been integrated into training modules provided to members of the SLM platform in Central West

description.narrative: Outcome 1 A Coordination platform for sustainable partnerships to enable an integrated approach to sustainable and equitable land management is established in the CentreWest Region

3 Existence of a regional SLM action plan validated by the platform and coordinating 75 of the SLM interventions of relevant the projects and initiatives implemented in the region
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
In order to standardise the language in indicators and facilitate the use of the SLM Interventions Database for informing this indicator we changed
the SLM related activities of all the projects and initiatives implemented in the region
to
SLM interventions of relevant the projects and initiatives implemented in the region

comment.narrative: No regional SLM platform that can be used as a coordinating framework between institutions and regional consultation frameworks dealing with sustainable land management

The regional partnership platform for SLM including all the local authorities project and others actors is functional and coordinate and link 75 of the activities related to SLM in the region through a multiyear regional action plan

Further progress made towards the target The CenterWest Regional Partnership Platform for Sustainable Land Management CWRPPSLM brings together about fifteen categories of SLM actors Administrative Authorities Decentralized Government Services Research and or Training Institutions Local Governments Traditional and Religious Leaders SLM Projects Programs Youth Ecological Clubs school and or university Decentralized financing structures of the rural sector communicatorsmedia Associations NGOs and umbrella structures active in the field of SLM Representative of AgroSylvoPastoral and Fisheries professions and interprofessions legal bodies for the settlement of rural land tenurerelated conflicts agricultural private sector service providers tools and inputs suppliers agroindustrial companies Mining companies It was officially installed on 23 October 2014 and had its first ordinary session on the same day This session was dedicated to the validation of the results of the baseline studies to develop the environmental profile and current status of microwatershed management in the intervention zone of the SubProgram In view of operationalizing the platform the Subprogram has supported the organization and holding of its second ordinary session in April 2015 which gave the opportunity to present and validate a roadmap for the implementation and coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region The preliminary draft of the roadmap submitted for validation in the General Assembly meeting of the platform was proposed by its Permanent Technical Core Group PTG which includes decentralized rural development structures and projects and programs involved in SLM in the region By initiating the roadmap for SLM activities in the region and development of a resource mobilization strategy to support its implementation the platform is entering in its operational phase of coordination of SLM interventions Part of the major activities in the roadmap is the organization of the regional SLM Day Through this the platform intends to raise the awareness of the general public and natural resource users in the region on the issues and challenges related to i land degradationii absence of action towards sustainable natural resource management iii economic ecological and social sustainability of development actions It is intended to secure their commitment to the implementation of actions that could contribute to reversing the current trend towards accelerated degradation of rural resources To give ample room to the platform for exercising its prerogatives and asserts its leadership in the coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region the Subprogram has given it a set of computer and audiovisual materials including a lap top multipurpose printer consumables video projector and five GPS devices for geo localizing of SLM works

The regional partnership platform for SLM including all the local authorities project and others actors is functional and coordinate and link 75 of the activities related to SLM in the region through a multiyear regional action plan

Further progress made towards the target The CenterWest Regional Partnership Platform for Sustainable Land Management CWRPPSLM brings together about fifteen categories of SLM actors Administrative companies Mining companies It was officially installed on 23 October 2014 and had its first ordinary session on the same day This session was dedicated to the validation of the results of the baseline studies to develop the environmental profile and current status of microwatershed management in the intervention zone of the SubProgram In view of operationalizing the platform the Subprogram has supported the organization and holding of its second ordinary session in April 2015 which gave the opportunity to present and validate a roadmap for the implementation and coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region The preliminary draft of the roadmap submitted for validation in the General Assembly meeting of the platform was proposed by its Permanent Technical Core Group PTG which includes decentralized rural development structures and projects and programs involved in SLM in the region By initiating the roadmap for SLM activities in the region and development of a resource mobilization strategy to support its implementation the platform is entering in its operational phase of coordination of SLM interventions Part of the major activities in the roadmap is the organization of the regional SLM Day Through this the platform intends to raise the awareness of the general public and natural resource users in the region on the issues and challenges related to i land degradationii absence of action towards sustainable natural resource management iii economic ecological and social sustainability of development actions It is intended to secure their commitment to the implementation of actions that could contribute to reversing the current trend towards accelerated degradation of rural resources To give ample room to the platform for exercising its prerogatives and asserts its leadership in the coordination of SLM initiatives and actions in the region the Subprogram has given it a set of computer and audiovisual materials including a lap top multipurpose printer consumables video projector and five GPS devices for geo localizing of SLM works

description.narrative: 4 The number of SLM interventions that have adopted the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and agreed to use it for monitoring their achievements

comment.narrative: There is no synergy among the actions and investment related to SLM in the region
75 of SLM initiatives in the region shared the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and contribute to its achievement

Further progress made towards the target The model data base was developed during the previous period It is being tested and gradually fed with data and information from baseline studies in the intervention area of the subprogram It is also fed with data from the studies on the development of technical standards instrument and costs applicable to SLM in the region which aims at identifying updating and listing the number and nature of SLM best practices disseminate in the CenterWest region and this constitute a significant contribution to the achievement of this target In addition reaching this target goes through the effective operationalization of the regional monitoring and evaluation mechanism To achieve this actions will be undertaken to conduct in July individual capacity building of the actors involved in the mechanism in terms of SLM data collection validation registration sending processing and filing At the end of these sessions the trainees shall be able to carry out missions and produce the information required for filling in 44 SLM outcome indicators that will be predefined in the data base The target audience is made up of representatives of SLM stakeholders most of whom are members of the regional SLM partnership platform The feedback between ONEDD and intermediary structures for dissemination down to the grassroots level makes it possible to complete the circuit thus facilitating the adoption ainsi use of this M E system for the implementation of SLM initiatives and interventions in the region To support the process and illustrate the feasibility of SLM a participatory M E manual drawing from a harmonized system and building on data from the baseline study for the CenterWest CPP Subprogram intervention in its priority zone was developed during the period under review The capacity building sessions planned during the month of July 2015 and beyond will incorporate the contents of this manual
75 of SLM initiatives in the region shared the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and contribute to its achievement

Further progress made towards the target The model data base was developed during the previous period It is being tested and gradually fed with data and information from baseline studies in the intervention area of the subprogram It is also fed with data from the studies on the development of technical standards instrument and costs applicable to SLM in the region which aims at identifying updating and listing the number and nature of SLM best practices disseminate in the CenterWest region and this constitute a significant contribution to the achievement of this target In addition reaching this target goes through the effective operationalization of the regional monitoring and evaluation mechanism To achieve this actions will be undertaken to conduct in July individual capacity building of the actors involved in the mechanism in terms of SLM data collection validation registration sending processing and filing At the end of these sessions the trainees shall be able to carry out missions and produce the information required for filling in 44 SLM outcome indicators that will be predefined in the data base The target audience is made up of representatives of SLM stakeholders most of whom are members of the regional SLM partnership platform The feedback between ONEDD and intermediary structures for dissemination down to the grassroots level makes it possible to complete the circuit thus facilitating the adoption ainsi use of this M E system for the implementation of SLM initiatives and interventions in the region To support the process and illustrate the feasibility of SLM a participatory M E manual drawing from a harmonized system and building on data from the baseline study for the CenterWest CPP Subprogram intervention in its priority zone was developed during the period under review The capacity building sessions planned during the month of July 2015 and beyond will incorporate the contents of this manual

description.narrative: Outcome 2 An institutional and policy environment which enhances awareness and implementation of sustainable and equitable land management is strengthened in the CentreWest Region

5 Regional Natural Resources Management Sustainable Land Management NRMSLM platform established and sustained
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014 Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes

comment.narrative: A regional NRMSLM platform for dealing with SLM issues in the Centre West Region does not exist or remains a proposal

The Regional NRMSLM platform for the Centre West Region has a multiyear functioning budget that allows it to convene annually and gather all relevant stakeholders by project end with good prospects to remain so as assessed by the MTR and TE

Progress made towards the target This budget is not yet in place and the functioning of the body is for the time being ensured with contributions from the public administration local government projects programs and other actors The current development of a resource mobilization strategy and its implementation will help to sustain the operations of the platform The organization of a regional SLM Day such as mentioned above will create a forum for advocacy for establishing sustainable partnerships and mobilizing resources for SLM and its platform Already the Forest Investment Platform FIP which is part of the REDD Burkina Faso process financed by the World Bank and ADB is committed to cofinancing the organization of this regional SLM Day

The Regional NRMSLM platform for the Centre West Region has a multiyear functioning budget that allows it to convene annually and gather all relevant stakeholders by project end with good prospects to remain so as assessed by the MTR and TE

Progress made towards the target This budget is not yet in place and the functioning of the body is for the time being ensured with contributions from the public administration local government projects programs and other actors The current development of a resource mobilization strategy and its implementation will help to sustain the operations of the platform The organization of a regional SLM Day such as mentioned above will create a forum for advocacy for establishing sustainable partnerships and mobilizing resources for SLM and its platform Already the Forest Investment Platform FIP which is part of the REDD Burkina Faso process financed by the World Bank and ADB is committed to cofinancing the organization of this regional SLM Day

description.narrative:
INDICATOR DROPPED
Number of regional programmatic frameworks CCDR CRAT CDR CCAR etc revised to include SLM principles
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
This indicator is a duplication from Indicator 2 and has been dropped

comment.narrative:
INDICATOR DROPPED
Several regional programmatic framework dont or weakly include SLM in their mandate

INDICATOR DROPPED
All the regional programmatic framework include SLM in their activities and through the regional coordination mechanism coordinate their SLM activities

description.narrative: 6 Proportion of a legal institutional and c capacity constraints to SLM in the region identified in the frame of the national coordination subprogram that are solved through legal and regulatory reform

comment.narrative:
No mechanism to identify legal institutional a and capacity b constraints to SLM and address them is in place
6a Major legal institutional constrains n3
The implementation and enforcement of the New Land Tenure Law Loi 0342009 Portant Régime Foncier Rural in the CW region is but incipient
The Regional NRMSLM platform for the Centre West Region is not yet legally formalised
The Regional NRMSLM platform for the Centre West Region remains a proposal
6b Major capacity constraints n20
Established through the application of a capacity development scorecard for SLM with 20 different combinations of scores covering on the Xaxe 3 levels of capacity Systemic Institutional and Individual 1 overall average and on the Yaxe 5 capacity themes
Baseline scores TBD

At least 50 of constraints identified n23 in the frame of the national coordination subprogram are solved through legal institutional and regulatory reform
6a There is tangible progress in implementing the New Land Tenure Law in the CW Region as assessed by the MTR and TE and a regional decree has been approved establishing the TOR for the Regional NRMSLM platform is legally established and meets regularly
6b Improvements in the total capacity score for SLM at 20 from the baselines absolute number

Not possible to assess indicator achievement No evaluation has yet been conducted on this indicator However the SubProgram has undertaken to disseminate ifive legislative and regulatory texts and iifive SLM planning and management tools in the field through information sensitization and training sessions of actors from the regional level to the communal level with the support of relevant structures of the central level and support to the local media print press and community radio stations This will indeed contribute to removing identified barriers and constraints It should be noted that five communes have received methodological technical and financial support from the subprogram for the establishment of local structures for rural land tenure management and individual capacity building of their members Additionnally all members of the NRMSLM platform have received capacity building sessions on i their roles and responsibilities within the platform ii the functioning principles of the platform iiiNRMSLM stakes and concepts iv relevant texts and their overlappings in the area of NRMSLM and v the alternative and judiciary regulations governing rural land tenure conflicts

At least 50 of constraints identified n23 in the frame of the national coordination subprogram are solved through legal institutional and regulatory reform
6a There is tangible progress in implementing the New Land Tenure Law in the CW Region as assessed by the MTR and TE and a regional decree has been approved establishing the TOR for the Regional NRMSLM platform is legally established and meets regularly
6b Improvements in the total capacity score for SLM at 20 from the baselines absolute number

Not possible to assess indicator achievement No evaluation has yet been conducted on this indicator However the SubProgram has undertaken to disseminate ifive legislative and regulatory texts and iifive SLM planning and management tools in the field through information sensitization and training sessions of actors from the regional level to the communal level with the support of relevant structures of the central level and support to the local media print press and community radio stations This will indeed contribute to removing identified barriers and constraints It should be noted that five communes have received methodological technical and financial support from the subprogram for the establishment of local structures for rural land tenure management and individual capacity building of their members Additionnally all members of the NRMSLM platform have received capacity building sessions on i their roles and responsibilities within the platform ii the functioning principles of the platform iiiNRMSLM stakes and concepts iv relevant texts and their overlappings in the area of NRMSLM and v the alternative and judiciary regulations governing rural land tenure conflicts

description.narrative: Outcome 3 Promote practices of integrated sustainable and equitable management of land which includes innovative practices or is based on local knowledge

8 Forest loss and forest gain in demo sites assessed visually through
httpwwwglobalforestwatchorgmap
For the following variables
UMDGoogle tree cover loss annual 30m global pink
UMDGoogle tree cover gain 12 years 30m global blue
More specifically
httpwwwglobalforestwatchorgmap101135181ALLgrayscalelossforestgainbegin20010101end20121201threshold10
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
This is a new indicator

comment.narrative:
2013
httpswwwdropboxcomshw6uavg2qdrpdnttAADEG4OfewrJz2pK9idxRMjWadl0
Specific monitored polygons including control sites remain to be defined and more accurate images acquired
The service is free

By project end forest loss is minimal in the perimeters defined as project sites and where forest as per the definitions of the tool can be found
Where possible any new pink pixels within the defined monitored polygons will be counted annually and compared to the 2013 baseline
Each pixel represents a 30x30m area of forest pink indicating loss
This method which is costless should be able to illustrate what is happening to forests where the project is expected to have a direct impact in halting the loss of forest and biomass
Some forest gain in project sites will also be noted though this is not part of the target
Not possible to inform indicator No measurement was made during the period under review However the baseline situation is being refined in order to facilitate future evaluations

By project end forest loss is minimal in the perimeters defined as project sites and where forest as per the definitions of the tool can be found
Where possible any new pink pixels within the defined monitored polygons will be counted annually and compared to the 2013 baseline
Each pixel represents a 30x30m area of forest pink indicating loss
This method which is costless should be able to illustrate what is happening to forests where the project is expected to have a direct impact in halting the loss of forest and biomass
Some forest gain in project sites will also be noted though this is not part of the target
Not possible to inform indicator No measurement was made during the period under review However the baseline situation is being refined in order to facilitate future evaluations

description.narrative: 7a Surfaces of farm land pastoral areas river banks and wetlands under SLM systems

comment.narrative: 7a surface is yet to be defined for retained project sites

7a Surface area under SLM in the CW Region
In the PRODOC this is what had been proposed
50000 ha of forest land
35000 ha of pastoral zone
10000 ha of river banks
5000 ha wetlands
10000 ha of agro biodiversity areas
10000 ha of peripheral areas for fauna protection under permanent SLM system
The project will update the target with more accurate figures in the 2015 PIR

Not yet possible to update the target with more accurate figures
On the scale of 41 microwatersheds identified in the five pilot and that will be a common integrated management planning development of their natural resources there is little or no land for different uses described in the PRODOC who are under Sustainable management In the Priority Intervention Zone the expected situation at the end of the project is as follows 2000 ha of agricultural land 750 ha of forest land 1500 hectares of agro pastoral land and or pasture areas 500 ha of banks 20 ha of wetlands 160 ha of irrigated land 375 hectares of eroded land The promotion of best practices was translated during the period under review into i development of detailed plans for the development of five model micro watersheds at a rate of one per commune selected from the 41 identified in 2014 in the communes of Bakata Bougnounou Dalo Leo and To In fact a model micro watershed is a demonstration site of water and soil conservatory management techniques and technologies It aims at serving as teaching farms for the dissemination of these techniques and technologies to all land users in the communes These water and land development schemes cover the following topics Current state of land use and practices used in tapping on these resources Techniques and technologies to be used Detailed costs of infrastructure to be constructed in the sites Building modalities of this infrastructure Timeframe given for the work Prerequisites before starting the work Training themes to be taught to the users of the microwatersheds In 2015 the targets in terms of areas under SLM are 150 ha of agricultural land 50 hectares of agro pastoral land Tiare in the town of DALO 20 ha of banks 30 ha of wetlands 30 ha of irrigated land 20 hectares of eroded land The operation will be assessed at the end of year 2015 and the lessons learned will serve for the gradual development of remaining micro watersheds and this at the initiative of the various priority communes and with the support of their technical and financial partners including CenterWest CPP

7a Surface area under SLM in the CW Region
In the PRODOC this is what had been proposed
50000 ha of forest land
35000 ha of pastoral zone
10000 ha of river banks
5000 ha wetlands
10000 ha of agro biodiversity areas
10000 ha of peripheral areas for fauna protection under permanent SLM system
The project will update the target with more accurate figures in the 2015 PIR

use and practices used in tapping on these resources Techniques and technologies to be used Detailed costs of infrastructure to be constructed in the sites Building modalities of this infrastructure description.narrative: 7b Percentage of producers successfully applying innovative technologies tested and adapted to SLM in the region now broken down by type of technology

comment.narrative: 7b Few if any to be determined at project start
7b 50 of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

Not yet possible to update the target with more accurate figures
For the period under review this indicators and its target were not measured However some actions towards the dissemination of SLM best practices and data collection to fill in the indicator were undertaken In fact to support the use of SLM techniques and technologies the Subprogram has initiated capacity building actions training sessions and establishment of teaching farms for selected farmer trainer extensionists in each of the five pilot communes Farmer trainer extensionists are groups of producers selected from the local population to act as permanent technical relays for the dissemination of SLM best practices at the level of the commune in a context marked by central government and its local branches disinvestment in extension services so that they can refocus on their core functions The five groups of farmer trainer extensionists constitute an initial core group that will be expanded through a networking system which is currently being developed In order to strengthen the technical and teaching capacities of the farmer trainer extensionists for disseminating the relevant techniques and technologies the trainings were supplemented with a study and exchange trip in the Northern region deeply degraded and HautsBassins agroecological conditions similar to those of the intervention zone of the Subprogram where the communities in order to preserve their natural resources apply water and land conservation techniques and technologies in their farms The purpose of the trip was to create enabling conditions for individual and collective awareness of natural resource degradation and sustainable management and to generate deeper conviction in the fulfilment of their new role
7b 50 of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

Not yet possible to update the target with more accurate figures
For the period under review this indicators and its target were not measured However some actions towards the dissemination of SLM best practices and data collection to fill in the indicator were undertaken In fact to support the use of SLM techniques and technologies the Subprogram has initiated capacity building actions training sessions and establishment of teaching farms for selected farmer trainer extensionists in each of the five pilot communes Farmer trainer extensionists are groups of producers selected from the local population to act as permanent technical relays for the dissemination of SLM best practices at the level of the commune in a context marked by central government and its local branches disinvestment in extension services so that they can refocus on their core functions The five groups of farmer trainer extensionists constitute an initial core group that will be expanded through a networking system which is currently being developed In order to strengthen the technical and teaching capacities of the farmer trainer extensionists for disseminating the relevant techniques and technologies the trainings were supplemented with a study and exchange trip in the Northern region deeply degraded and HautsBassins agroecological conditions similar to those of the intervention zone of the Subprogram where the communities in order to preserve their natural resources apply water and land conservation techniques and technologies in their farms The purpose of the trip was to create enabling conditions for individual and collective awareness of natural resource degradation and sustainable management and to generate deeper conviction in the fulfilment of their new role

description.narrative:
9 Number of practical SLM documents produced and widely disseminated by CPP eg best practices field guides local innovations lessons learned leaflets radio series
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We have moved this indicator It would be better placed under Outcome 3 in the current project setting

comment.narrative: Few and poorly disseminated
At the end of the subprogram at least 8 goodquality documents and 12 IEC products are elaborated by various organizations jointly

Further progress made towards the target 25 achievement Four IEC outputs in the form of a documentary film and picture box with diverse contents as well as radio programmes were produced They deal with the following themes teaching farms to disseminate SLM best practices Seeing understanding and acting and Protecting and restoring stream and water body banks for improved production setting up of local structures for rural land tenure management scope of the deliberations of the subprogram steering committee and synergy in actionsof SLM actors
Three 3 relevant documents on SLM best practices are being produced the training module on water and soil conservatory management techniques and technologies the reference tool for technical norms and costs applicable to SLM in the CenterWest region and the illustrated SLM best practice guide
In addition the Subprogramme has already in collaboration with a theater production company undertaken to design create and disseminate interactive theater plays on i conservatory best practices ii individual and collective accountability for natural resource degradation control iii the benefits of applying water and land conservatory management techniques and technologies in the farms
At the end of the subprogram at least 8 goodquality documents and 12 IEC products are elaborated by various organizations jointly

Further progress made towards the target 25 achievement Four IEC outputs in the form of a documentary film and picture box with diverse contents as well as radio programmes were produced They deal with the following themes teaching farms to disseminate SLM best practices Seeing understanding and acting and Protecting and restoring stream and water body banks for improved production setting up of local structures for rural land tenure management scope of the deliberations of the subprogram steering committee and synergy in actionsof SLM actors
Three 3 relevant documents on SLM best practices are being produced the training module on water and soil conservatory management techniques and technologies the reference tool for technical norms and costs applicable to SLM in the CenterWest region and the illustrated SLM best practice guide
In addition the Subprogramme has already in collaboration with a theater production company undertaken to design create and disseminate interactive theater plays on i conservatory best practices ii individual and collective accountability for natural resource degradation control iii the benefits of applying water and land conservatory management techniques and technologies in the farms

for 2013 and 2014 simply reflected the LOGFRAME as in the PRODOC without any critical review of the projects M and E framework
